B is correct
C is wrong, B is correct as corrective action is taken in Controlling a stage process.

choices.D: To update a project plan to incorporate the actuals from a stage plan
choices.A: To produce a team plan for the work to be assigned to a team manager
choices.B: To select and implement actions that will resolve deviations from a plan within tolerance

questions.question_text: Which is a purpose of the 'controlling a stage' process?
Which role is responsible for the quality of the specialist products delivered in the project?

discussion.content: Senior User is responsible for specifying the desired result or requirement. Senior Supplier is responsible for delivering.

C. Senior Supplier is correct. Reference Prince2 guide, section C.2.1 :
" hold the senior supplier to account for the quality and integrity of the specialist approach and specialist 
products created for the project"
C is correct, as senior supplier is responsible for creating products.

C
C.4: The senior supplier represents the interests of those designing, developing, facilitating, procuring and
implementing the project’s products. This role is accountable for the quality of products delivered by the
supplier(s) and is responsible for the technical integrity of the project. If necessary, more than one person
may represent the suppliers.
C, the supplier delivers the products, this, is responsible for their quality.
it should be B
I think its the Senior User who is responsible so Answer is B

questions.question_text: What must be included in the risk management approach, as a minimum requirement for applying the risk theme?

choices.B: An explanation of the company's risk appetite
choices.A: A description of the risk management procedure
choices.D: Estimations of the likelihood and impact of risks
choices.C: The names of the assigned actionees for each risk

discussion.content: Information about all project risks are maintained in a risk register, and a risk management approach is written to outline the general approach to risk management during the project. Included in this approach is a description of the risk management procedure.

questions.question_text: What is the definition of a project outcome?

choices.C: The result of the change derived from using the project's outputs
choices.A: A measurable improvement that is perceived as an advantage by one or more stakeholders

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the result of a change is implemented to achieve outcomes- the definition of an outcome.

The correct answer is C and not D. The definition you presented is not quite accurate, it's a small detail that makes the difference. The OUTCOME is the result of a change results from project's OUTPUT (not outcome).

C: "outcome
The result of change, normally affecting real-world behaviour and/or circumstances. Outcomes are desired when a change is conceived. They are achieved as a result of the activities undertaken to effect the change.
C without doubts: the outcome can be understood as a change caused by using the project’s output

Answer is C:

outcome
The result of change, normally affecting real-world behaviour and/or circumstances. Outcomes are desired when
a change is conceived. They are achieved as a result of the activities undertaken to effect the change.

Correct answer is D. 
Option C is the result of change which have been derived from project outcome. So how it can be a project's outcome?

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
B is correct "assess any benefits that have already been realized and update the benefits management approach to include any post-project benefit reviews"

The objective of the closing a project process is to:
- verify user acceptance of the project's products
- ensure that the host site is able to support the products when the project is disbanded
- review the performance of the project against its baselines
- assess any benefits that have already been realized and update the benefits management approach to include any post-project benefit reviews
- ensure that provision has been made to address all open issues and risks, with follow-on action recommendations.

questions.question_text: Which is an objective of the Closing a Project process?

choices.C: Produce a Benefits Review Plan to identify what benefits are expected
choices.A: Prepare the plan for the next stage
choices.D: Check that all benefits are realized before closing a project
choices.B: Assess any benefits that have already been realized
